title: Honoring Ziad Hammodi upon the occasion of his designation for special recognition
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring  Ziad Hammodi upon the occasion of his
designation for special recognition by the Federation of  Italian-Ameri-
can Organizations of Brooklyn, Ltd.

WHEREAS,  It is the sense of this Legislative Body to recognize that the
quality and character of life in the communities across New  York  State
are  reflective of the concerned and dedicated efforts of those individ-
uals who devote themselves to the welfare of the community and its citi-
zenry; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body is justly proud to honor  Ziad  Hammodi
upon  the  occasion  of  his  designation for special recognition by the
Federation of Italian-American Organizations of Brooklyn,  Ltd.,  to  be
celebrated at its 34th Anniversary Gala on March 27, 2011; and
  WHEREAS, Ziad Hammodi is the Deputy Practice Group Leader for the Real
Estate  Group  in  the New York office of Reed Smith, one of the largest
international law firms; and
  WHEREAS, Ziad Hammodi joined Reed Smith in 2003 after spending  nearly
four  years  with  the  New  York law firm of Siller Wilk LLP; he worked
there first as a law clerk and then as a summer associate,  then  joined
the Corporate Real Estate Group as an associate in 2001; and
  WHEREAS, Ziad Hammodi has substantial experience in all aspects of the
sale  and acquisition of real estate, including office buildings, indus-
trial buildings and multi-family residential properties; he  has  exten-
sive  experience in real estate finance, including conduit loan programs
and permanent and  construction  loan  transactions  for  borrowers  and
institutional  lenders involving multi-family residential and commercial
properties; additionally, he has considerable knowledge  in  sale-lease-
back transactions and representation of landlords and tenants in commer-
cial office leases; and
  WHEREAS,  Proficient  in French and Arabic, Ziad Hammodi is a graduate
of Tulane University where he earned his B.S.M. in Finance in 1998,  and
the Brooklyn Law School receiving his J.D. in 2001; and
  WHEREAS,  Growing up in Livingston, New Jersey, Ziad Hammodi currently
resides with his wife, Reyna, on Staten Island; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of  this  Legislative  Body  that  those  who
enhance the quality of life in their community and have shown a long and
sustained  commitment  to  the  maintenance  of  high standards in their
profession, certainly have earned the recognition and  applause  of  all
the citizens of this great Empire State; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Ziad Hammodi upon the occasion  of  his  designation  for  special
recognition  by  the  Federation  of  Italian-American  Organizations of
Brooklyn, Ltd.; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Ziad Hammodi.
